zone.line: & in addition to these, balsam & the palm
tree. The palm tree arrives here to great size
& beauty. The balsam is a tree of moderate
size; as each branch swells, if the knife be applied,
the veins lie open: they are recieved in the fragment
of a stone or a cask: the moisture is useful
to pl for medical purposes. Lebanon is the
loftiest of their mountains, preserving snow
even in that burning climate. This mountain
nourishes & pours forth the river Jordan.
Nor is Jordan recieved into the sea, but
flows through two lakes entire & is retained
by the third. This lake is of immense
circumference, like the a sea; but more corrupted
to taste; it is pestilential from thi its stench
to the inhabitants of its shores: it is never
agitated by the wind, nor does it contain either
fish or birds accustomed to the water.
The water is scarcely water; it bears, like
solid ground, every thing which is thrown
upon it, & those who cannot swim are and
